alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Rawlins; Sherman; Thomas (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 7:02PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Cheyenne, northwestern Thomas, southern Rawlins and northeastern Sherman Counties in northwestern Kansas through 630 PM MDT/730 PM CDT/... At 602 PM MDT/702 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles northwest of Gem to 7 miles north of Levant to 5 miles north of Brewster. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Cheyenne, northwestern Thomas, southern Rawlins and northeastern Sherman Counties in northwestern Kansas, including the following locations... Edson, Blakeman and Beardsley. This includes Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 21 and 34, and between mile markers 38 and 41. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT/1000 PM CDT/ for northwestern Kansas.
